lessonAnalyses.lessonTitle: Who is Affected by Intimate Partner Violence?

opportunities.title: Trauma-Informed Conversation Simulator
opportunities.description: Practice having trauma-informed conversations with survivors using realistic dialogue options
opportunities.learningObjective: Demonstrate trauma-informed communication techniques with survivors

opportunities.title: IPV Case Analysis
opportunities.description: Analyze a realistic case study, identify abuse patterns, and recommend appropriate interventions
opportunities.learningObjective: Apply frameworks to identify IPV patterns and recommend interventions

opportunities.title: Abuse Type Categorization
opportunities.description: Drag behaviors/examples into the correct abuse category (physical, emotional, economic, etc.)
opportunities.learningObjective: Correctly identify and categorize different types of abuse

opportunities.title: Cycle of Violence Sequencing
opportunities.description: Arrange phases of the cycle of violence in the correct order and identify characteristics
opportunities.learningObjective: Understand the sequential nature of the abuse cycle

notes: Multiple interactive opportunities available
Prioritize based on learning impact and development time

opportunities.title: Interactive Response Scenario
opportunities.description: Learners make decisions about how to respond to an IPV situation, with branching paths based on their choices
opportunities.learningObjective: Apply appropriate response strategies in realistic IPV situations

recommendations: Phase 1 includes basic knowledge-checks and reflections (âœ“)
Phase 2 identifies opportunities for ADVANCED interactivity:
- Case study analysis with Johnson's Typologies (Module 3)
- Additional branching scenarios for complex situations
1. Implement high-priority, low-complexity items first (drag-drop, hot spots)
2. Build 1-2 high-complexity items for critical content (case study, simulation)
3. Test and iterate based on learner feedback
4. Add optional items in future iterations
